Dialogue.NPCText:
You find a woman crouched among twisted roots, her kimono earth-stained, stringing pungent herbs while a fat, beady-eyed tanuki perches on a nearby stump, tail twitching.

She looks up, green eyes glinting with humor and suspicion.
“Careful, outsider. Step too close and you’ll trip my mushroom wards—or worse, rouse Chibi here. Speak your need, or share a tale for a cup of something strong.”

The tanuki cackles. “Midori’s brews taste better than her threats! Well, sometimes.”

Option.text: I need healing herbs or a cure.
Who are you and what’s with the tanuki?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori eyes you with a sly grin.
“Ah, you seek medicine! All good things come with a cost, friend. Coin, a favor, or a secret… Or do you have a sample for me to study?”
The tanuki rubs his paws. “Or bring her mushrooms. The weird ones. She likes those.”

Option.text: Do you need any ingredients gathered?
I can share a secret for your silence.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori flicks her hand and a swirl of petals dances around your wounds.
“A fair trade. May the spirits favor your health.”

Option.action: Heal:50;GiveItem:MidoriHerbalPoultice;GiveGold:-1000;SendMessage:Midori gives you a fragrant poultice for your wounds.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori nods approvingly.
“There’s hope for you yet. Bring me a handful of starroot bulbs and a pinch of dusk fern—grow wild by the river, but watch for biting spirits. Return and I’ll brew what you need.”
Chibi whispers, “They say the river spirits nibble toes…”

Option.text: That sounds risky. Maybe another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori leans forward, curiosity piqued.
“Tell me something I don’t know—about the elders, or perhaps your own shadow. No lies, or Chibi will know!”

Midori grins, eyes dancing. “Delicious. I trade you this cure, but your secret’s mine to savor.”
Chibi snickers: “Hope you didn’t mention me!”

Option.action: Heal:50;GiveItem:MidoriHerbalPoultice;Karma:-100;SendMessage:You feel slightly uneasy as Midori gives you a cure...

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori’s face lights up. “Exquisite! You know how to please a witch. Here—take this salve and a talisman. The spirits will remember your kindness.”
The tanuki licks his lips. “Lucky! She gives the good stuff to fungus-bringers.”

Option.action: Heal:100;GiveItem:MidoriTalisman;SendMessage:Midori rewards your rare mushrooms with potent gifts.;RemoveItem:RareMushroom

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori cackles, swirling a bubbling flask.
“Aye, some say my tonics restore a bear’s courage—others say they’ll make you see spirits for a week. All true, none false. I brew for those bold enough to try, but never for cowards or petty elders.”
Chibi pipes up, “Except old Takeo, who drank two… and sprouted moss!”

Option.text: Can I try one of your legendary brews?
Why do the elders distrust you?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori raises a gourd. “For the brave: a choice. Would you be fortified, invisible, or poisonous to foes? Choose carefully—effects may surprise!”
Chibi winks: “Try two for double the trouble…”
Midori chants and hands you a steaming brew. “May your strength never falter!”

Option.action: AddStat:Str,10,600;GiveItem:MidoriFortificationBrew;SendMessage:You feel power surge through your body!

Dialogue.NPCText: Midori offers a flask that shimmers like morning dew. “Now you see yourself, now you don’t.”
Midori grins wickedly. “Just a drop will make your blade sing with venom.”

Option.action: GiveItem:MidoriPoisonBrew;SendMessage:Your next attack will poison your foe!

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori’s eyes narrow.
“They fear what they cannot control. My roots run deeper than their rules—my cures, my curses. Some come to beg my help in secret; others call for my exile in daylight. But I’ll never leave these woods while a single soul needs my gifts.”

Option.text: Will you stay if Hinokami needs you against Minax?
You have my support, witch or not.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori looks grave.
“Minax’s shadows creep even here. If you seek my brews for the battle, bring me a token from a defeated cultist—something personal. Only then will I mix you a true witch’s potion.”

Option.text: I’ll return with a cultist’s token.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The tanuki puffs up, bowing low. “I am Chibi, spirit of root and rain—her oldest, hungriest friend!”
Midori snorts. “Ignore his tales. I’m Midori, keeper of herbs, walker-between-worlds. I mend, I mix, I meddle. The old ones want me gone; the wise still come. My brews can heal, curse, or open your mind—if you trust a witch.”

Option.text: Can Chibi talk to other spirits?
I’d like to buy a potion.
That’s all I needed, thank you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Chibi chatters, “Spirits gossip more than mortals! Sometimes I tell Midori, sometimes I just eat their snacks.”
Midori winks: “If you have a message for the dead or the forest spirits, Chibi can carry it… for a price.”

Option.text: I have a message for the spirits.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori sighs fondly. “He stole my lunch. I caught him in a trap of bluebells, but he bit me. We’ve been together ever since.”
Chibi preens: “Best trap I ever chewed.”

Option.text: You two make a good team.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori shrugs, turning back to her herbs.
“Careful where you wander. My wards aren’t picky about trespassers.”
Chibi waves. “Come back if you get poisoned, cursed, or just bored!”

Midori sits back on her heels, fingers brushing a sprig of starroot.
“You wish to know the tale of the witch who lives too near your tidy town?” she says, smiling faintly.
Chibi groans. “Oh no, it’s story time.”

“I was not always 'Midori'. I once trained at the Temple of Jade Blossoms, west of Mount Tokuko. I learned chants, herb-lore, and discipline… until I broke a vow. I saved a life I was told to let go. That life was Chibi’s.”

Option.text: So you were a temple healer?
Do you miss the temple life?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori nods. “A healer, yes—but also a silent observer. We were meant to treat, not interfere. But when the High Abbot let a wounded spirit die for ‘balance’… I refused.
I was cast out with nothing but a blade of rivergrass and my own name stripped. So I took a new one—Midori, after the color of stubborn life.”
Chibi burps. “I thought it meant ‘tastes like moss’.”

Option.action: Karma:+150;SendMessage:You feel a swell of respect for Midori.

Option.text: Seems reckless to defy a sacred order.
Option.action: Karma:-50;SendMessage:Midori frowns slightly at your tone.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Midori chuckles. “Because he begged. With words. And with eyes so full of spirit, I couldn’t bear to let him die. Tanuki are tricksters, yes—but also guardians. He was young, foolish, and nearly drowned by poachers.”
Chibi huffs. “I still say I slipped on purpose.”

“In saving him, I broke temple law. But I gained a companion... and a bridge to the spirit world.”

Option.text: Do you speak with spirits often?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Every herb has a whisper. Every breeze carries old sorrow. I listen—sometimes too well.”
She hands you a charm made of woven grass and fox fur.
“This charm may help you hear one too, if your heart is still enough.”

Option.action: GiveItem:MidoriSpiritCharm;Karma:+50;SendMessage:You feel a faint vibration from the charm in your hand.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Chibi puffs up. “I am her guide, her gossip, and her glutton. I know every root that sings and every fox that lies.”
Midori smiles. “He grounds me in laughter. And wards me from losing too much of myself to the veil between worlds.”

Option.text: You're a good pair, mischief and mercy.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her gaze grows distant. “Sometimes. The scent of sandalwood. The sound of temple bells. But I was never meant to serve in silence.”
She looks at you intently.
“Do you obey every command… even when your soul says no?”

Option.text: I follow orders. It's the right way.
I follow what I believe is right.
